field.label: PROXY Protocol
field.help: If you enable the proxy protocol, an upstream proxy or server will get the client IP and the server port before the real traffic is sent.

field.label: Host header port
field.help: Add this port value to the Host header. Not used by default.

field.label: XFH: Use original Host header
field.help: Use Host header value from the client request ($http_host) for X-Forwarded-Host header. $host variable is used by default. Enabling this may cause incorrect behavior in case of malicious requests such as incorrect hostnames being logged or invalid redirects being performed.

field.label: Enable TLS (HTTPS)
field.help: Use TLS (HTTPS) to connect to the server.

field.label: TLS: Client Certificate
field.help: Authenticate on the Server using a client certificate.

field.label: TLS: Servername override
field.help: Force a specific hostname for the backend connection instead of passing the hostname from the downstream connection to the upstream connection.

field.label: TLS: Verify Certificate
field.help: Don't turn it off unless you really know what you are doing! Never do it because a random website tells you to do.

field.label: TLS: Verify Depth
field.help: Choose how many sub-CAs can be between the server certificate and a trusted CA. 1 means the certificate has to be signed directly by a CA.

field.label: Store
field.help: Store the response on the local storage.
